comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3422) (MYAIR-3844)
#1.  The App shall allow any currently signed-in user to delete/close their myAir account
#2.  When the user chooses to delete/close their account, the App shall require the user to enter their password
#3.  The App shall notify the user if the password provided cannot be authenticated (i.e. invalid password)
#4.  If the password provided is validated and the user's account is deleted/closed, the App shall logout the user

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: User should be able to navigate to "Close my account" and see the "Close my account" button

steps.name: I open the app on the "Profile Settings" screen
I tap the "More delete my account" button
I should be on the "Delete my account" screen

#4.  If the password provided is validated and the user's account is deleted/closed, the App shall logout the user

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-801) (MYAIR-1330)
# 1. The user shall be able to check for new coaching content from Patient Portal

# 2. When the user visits coaching and the coaching section has not been updated for more than 1 hour, then the coaching shall be requested from Patient Portal (note: does not include opening from a coaching Push notification)
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-153) (MYAIR-101)
# 1. The user shall be shown the coaching assets that have been generated from Patient Portal since registration
# 2. The coaching shall be shown chronologically from the most recent item to the oldest item
# 3. Selecting a video shall start the video
# NOTE: For iOS we have "More" screen and for android is "Settings" screen

# NOTE: Testing for coaching update by tagging push notifications will be tested in MYAIR-1060 story. These following scenarios do not apply to the case of accessing coaching from push notification item

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account with coaching data
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: There have not been any coaching tip updates for an hour, so if the user returns to Coaching from the Dashboard, the app should still receive a call from patient portal by automatic page refresh

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I open the app on the "Coaching Timeline" screen
I wait for coaching sync
I should see the current "Coaching Timeline" content
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
it has been "61" minutes since last coaching sync
Patient Portal responses are delayed by "5" seconds for "1" response
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
Coaching Content should be requested
I should see the current "Coaching Timeline" content

name: Coaching History and when to update

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-510) (MYAIR-3128)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support
# 2. The user shall be able to select a category, subcategory and question for the help request
# 3. When the user has selected a category, subcategory and question, Monte Carlo shall provide a link to the relevant support section.
# 4. The user shall be able to enter a description for the help request
# 5. The description shall be limited to 400 characters
# 6. When the user has chosen a category, subcategory, question, and written at least one character in the description, they shall be able to submit the help request
# 7. When the user has submitted the help request, Monte Carlo shall send the user's help request, first name, email address and FG serial number to Patient Portal
# Note: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Support+screen+improvement
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1636) (MYAIR-2015)
# 1. If a user selects a clinically related question in the support form, then they will be shown a message to contact their care provider
# note: this behaviour is because the support service can not answer treatment or therapy related queries.
# https://confluence.ec2.local/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=39259556

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support and have various items to select in Subcategory for Library Category

steps.name: I open the app on the "Settings" screen
I tap the "myAir Support" item
I should be on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I should be on the "Contact support" screen
I pick "Library" for the "Category" field
there should be the option "Viewing information" in the "Subcategory" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-694) (MCA-2048)
# 1. Each sleep score shall be accompanied with a message according to the following rules:
# | requirement id | Condition                               | Text                                                                      | Notes                                                     |
# | 1a             | Usage is greater than 7 hours           | Excellent results, name! As you start to see the benefits in your life,   | name is replaced with the user's first name               |
# |                |                                         | youll never look back.                                                   |                                                           |
# | 1b             | Usage is less than or equal to 7 hours  | That's a great score! You're well on your way to improving your health.   |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 4 hours                |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1c             | Usage is less than or equal to 4 hours  | Good start! Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy will    |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 2 hours                | get easier the more you practice.                                         |                                                           |
# | 1d             | Usage is less than or equal to 2 hours  | Keep going name! If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out  | name is replaced with the users first name                |
# |                | and greater than 0 minutes              | support. Try the myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                 |                                                           |
# | 1e             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used last night! Do you need more support? Try the    |                                                           |
# |                | for the latest sleep record             | myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                                  |                                                           |
# | 1f             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used this night.                                      |                                                           |
# |                | not for the latest sleep record         |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1g             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | Last night's data isn't available yet.                                    |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there is data for the       |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | previous sleep record, or this is the   |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | only sleep record available             |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1h             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time. To ensure     |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there has been no data for  | that your machine can send data, review the tips on the Missing Data page.|                                                           |
# |                | the most recent 2 or more sleep records |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1i             | No data, score is not for the latest    | myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.               |                                                           |
# |                | sleep record                            |                                                                           |                                                           |
# Note: Monte Carlo only receives the number of therapy sessions per sleep record and does not know when each therapy session starts and ends.
# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when running 2 hours 1 minutes of therapy, applicable message appears

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "Good start!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy gets easier the more you practice." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy gets easier the more you practice.

I should be on the "Terms of Use" screen
I tap the "Back" button
I should be on the "About app" screen

elements.name: Patient Portal Server does not respond when user tries to access "Terms of Use" screen

I open the app on the "About app" screen
Patient Portal requests will time out
I tap the "Privacy Notice" button
I should see the "Server error" dialog

I should be on the "Privacy Notice" screen

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3537) (MYAIR-3930)
#  1.  Given the patient is signed-in and already has a device registered with their account, then the App shall allow the patient to change the device registered with their account
#  Note: See MCA-3536 for device registration requirements
# For testing Use these Values:
#    Existing Account : test.resmed11+139@gmail.com / Resmed123  (Default Device = 69362761035 )
#    Updated Device Serial : 56855204271
# V5 Patient Portal Endpoints : https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/V5+Patient+Portal+Endpoints
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3002)(MCA-2536)
# 1. If the user has an AirSense in their account, then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine that is provided by Patient Portal
# 2. In the event Patient Portal returns last sync time as "1900-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine as "-"
# Note 1: By default the App displays "-" for last sync time (i.e. sync has yet to occur).
# Note 2: Example format for displaying last sync time is Jan 12, 1952 3:30 PM
# Note 3: Date and time is based on the phone's local date and time
# Note:  All the test scenarios in this feature file require usage of the Patient Portal server
# Mock uses the following serial numbers / devices numbers / make / models for responses
# | Serial Number | Device Number | Made By            | Model                          | Notes                 |
# | 78899898308   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 Autoset            | * Default in mock     |
# | 56221828959   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her    |                       |

steps.name: I enable Wifi
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Patient attempts to update Device by providing a valid device number with matching serial number for a Device that is not supported by myAir in this region, then app informs the user that the device cannot be updated.

steps.name: I open the app on the "My equipment" screen
I tap the "Update machine" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I enter "73428033045" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "234" into the "Device number" field
Patient Portal will return a "27" response error code
I tap the "Save" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I should see the text "The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again."

arguments.val: The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Display of day without data

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I navigate to 2 sleep records back
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-453) (MCA-2442)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3050) (MCA-2495)
# 1. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the usage in hours and minutes, rounded down to the nearest minute
# 2. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display "Good" if the 95th percentile of the mask leak is less than 24 L/min
# 3. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display "Adjust" if the 95th percentile of the mask leak is equal to or greater than 24 L/min

# 4. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the events per hour as an index of the total number of Apnea, Central Apnea and Obstructive Apnea and Hypopnea events, per hour of usage, with a tolerance of +/-0.1
# 5. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the number of mask pairs
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1142) (MCA-2494)
# 1. If the usage for a Sleep record is zero minutes, the score shall be zero
# 2. If the usage for a sleep record is zero minutes, the *raw data values* shall be shown as a dash
# 3. If the usage for a sleep record is zero minutes, the *score breakdown values* shall be zero
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1633) (MYAIR-2262)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall show the Sleep Score received from Patient Portal
# 2. The Sleep Score shall be displayed with the start date for the beginning of the sleep record
# 3. If new Sleep Score data is received for an existing sleep record, the most recently received Sleep Score shall be shown

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

I see these scores
I see these values
I navigate to 1 day back
I see these scores
I see these values

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2871) (MYAIR-3574)
# 1. The App shall utilize the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol to ensure all communication with ResMed web servers is secure.
# 2.  In the event a SSL connection cannot be established with ResMed web servers due to issues with embedded certificates, then the App shall inform the user.
# 3.  When the user is informed of a SSL connection error, the App shall allow the user to proceed at their own risk.

# 4.  In the event the user choses to proceed at their own risk, the App shall disregard SSL connection errors and stop informing the user of subsequent SSL connection errors until the App is placed in the background
# Note: Once the App is re-opened the App will inform the user of any subsequent SSL connection errors.

elements.name: Verify the SSL certificate on the app, if valid app will not inform the user about SSL connection errors

steps.name: I open the app on the "Welcome" screen
Patient Portal will return a "matching ssl certificate" response
I sign in with an existing account
I should not see the "ssl error" dialog
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

elements.name: Verify the SSL certificate on the app, if not valid app will inform the user about SSL connection errors

steps.name: I sign in with an existing account
Patient Portal will return a "matching ssl certificate" response
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for network sync
I should not see the "ssl error" dialog
I put the app in the background
Patient Portal will return a "ssl error code" response
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the "ssl error" dialog

elements.name: Verify the SSL certificate on the app, if not valid app will inform the user about SSL connection errors

steps.name: I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I navigate to the "My equipment" screen
I tap the "Update mask" button
I should be on the "Change mask" screen
I select "Full face" for Mask Type
I select "ResMed" for Mask Brand
I select "AirFit F20 for Her" for Mask Model
Patient Portal will return a "ssl error code" response
I tap the "Update" button
I wait for data sync
I should see the "ssl error" dialog
I tap the "continue" button
I wait for network sync
the mask type "Full face" mask brand "ResMed" and mask model "AirFit F20 for Her" values are sent to Patient Portal
I should be on the "My equipment" screen
I should see the value "ResMed" in the "Mask Made by" label
I should see the value "AirFit F20 for Her" in the "Mask Model" label
I put the app in the background
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
Patient Portal will return a "ssl error code" response error code
I navigate to the "Profile" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the "ssl error" dialog
